required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Multiplexed Heptapeptides for Detection of Neoplasia in the Esophagus
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I In-vivo Study of Multiplexed Heptapeptides for Detection of Neoplasia in the Esophagus

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim of this feasibility study is to develop new technologies for improved detection of Barrett's neoplasia using the scanning fiber endoscope(SFE) multiplexed imaging system. This study will combine the use of fluorescent-labeled peptides that bind specifically to pre-cancerous mucosa in the esophagus for use as novel imaging agents to guide endoscopic biopsy or endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR). This Phase 1 study will be used to provide early evidence of efficacy for the topical application of a panel of two peptides that bind to molecular targets that are specific for esophageal dysplasia. A panel is needed because cancer in the esophagus is genetically heterogeneous. The study will look at peptide binding in subjects with known or suspected Barrett's esophagus.

primary_outcome.measure: Validate the binding of the peptides using the SFE
primary_outcome.description: The binding of the fluorescent-labeled peptides (QRH-882260 and KSP-910638G) that bind to EGFR and HER2 using an SFE molecular imaging system (SFE) determined using the tumor-to-background ratio for fluorescence intensities

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of the SFE to detect QRH and KSP via signal to noise ratio (SNR)
secondary_outcome.description: One aspect of feasibility will be shown by examining the SNR of the images collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of the SFE to detect QRH and KSP via tumor-to-background ratio
secondary_outcome.description: One aspect of feasibility will be shown by examining the tumor-to-background ratio of the images collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of the SFE to detect QRH and KSP via contrast
secondary_outcome.description: One aspect of feasibility will be shown by examining the contrast in the two channels in the images collected.

arm_group.description: QRH & KSP sprayed onto area of interest and imaged before and after application

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected Barrett's esophagus
- Scheduled for a clinically-indicated upper endoscopy
- Medically cleared for the procedure
- Willing and able to sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy or negative reaction to the near infrared fluorophores Cy5, li-cor IRDye800CW, or derivatives
- One active chemotherapy or radiation treatment
- Pregnant or trying to conceive
